title: History of Typography
content:
Hi all,

I want to learn the history of typography. I need some sources. So far I have found

Anatomy of a typeface  
Elements of the typographic style

Any others? Thanks.

 [‹ What are the dullest fonts around?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27800 "Go to previous forum topic") [Sans to Complement Kepler ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31884 "Go to next forum topic")

comments.content:
Althought these need updating, they are a good place to start:  
 [http://typophile.com/books/graphicdesign-history](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/books/graphicdesign-history)  
 [http://typophile.com/books/typedesign-history](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/books/typedesign-history)

See also:  
 [Best book you would recommend on typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/node/28627)  
 [Top three must have books on typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/node/28754)  
 [Recommend reading?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/node/20901)  
 [Sort of “desert island books”](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/node/30156)  
 [Typophile books for newbies](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/node/3657)  
 [evolution of type and alphabet](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/node/28813)  
 [Which typography book to buy](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/node/8857)

Don’t forget our wiki entry: [http://typophile.com/wiki/Books](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Books)  
Especially the holy triumvirate: [http://typophile.com/wiki/Triumvirate](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Triumvirate)

One author that could be added to the existing list of books on graphic design history is Richard Hollis:

**[Graphic Design, A Concise History](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/www.amazon.com/Graphic-Design-Concise-History-Second/dp/0500203474/sr=1-3/qid=1172626048/ref=sr_1_3/102-2355574-4800156?ie=UTF8&s=books)** (Second edition)

**[Swiss Graphic Design: The Origins and Growth of an International Style, 1920-1965](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/www.amazon.com/Swiss-Graphic-Design-International-1920-1965/dp/0300106769/sr=1-1/qid=1172626048/ref=sr_1_1/102-2355574-4800156?ie=UTF8&s=books)**

**[Avant Garde Graphics 1918-1934: From the Merrill C. Berman Collection](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/www.amazon.com/Avant-Garde-Graphics-1918-1934-Merrill-Collection/dp/1853322385/sr=1-8/qid=1172626048/ref=sr_1_8/102-2355574-4800156?ie=UTF8&s=books)** (with Lutz Becker)

don’t forget Stop Stealing Sheep & Find Out How Type Works, By Erik Spiekermann, E.M Ginger, E.M Ginger.

[http://www.adobepress.com/bookstore/product.asp?isbn=0201703394&redir=1&...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/www.adobepress.com/bookstore/product.asp?isbn=0201703394&redir=1&rl=1 "http://www.adobepress.com/bookstore/product.asp?isbn=0201703394&redir=1&rl=1")

A couple more:

Updike, D. B. “Printing Types, their history, form, and uses”. (the standard reference for pre-twentieth century)

Carter, H. “The Le Bé Memorandum” (history of 16th century French typefounding).

Haley, Allan. “Typographic Milestones”

Gray, N. “Nineteenth Century Ornamented Typefaces” (the Nash version has American as well as English)

Most everything else you can find in the bibliographies of what’s already been mentioned.

George  
I felt bad because I had no shoes, until I met a man who had no Bodoni

If you can afford a copy, [Revival of the Fittest](http://web.archive.org/web/20080430120055/http:/www.worldretailstore.com/item/BE-1883915082.html) is worth tracking down. I managed to dig up a copy in January for $40 with a lot of searching.
